articles.title: Heart attack survivors may be less likely to develop Parkinson's disease - Medical Xpress
articles.description: People who have had a heart attack may be slightly less likely than people in the general population to develop Parkinson's disease later in life, according to new research published today in the Journal of the American Heart Association, an open access, peer…

articles.author: Alan Blinder
articles.title: Olympics 2022 Live: US Men's Hockey Is Eliminated - The New York Times
articles.description: The U.S. team, which rose to the Olympic tournament’s top seed after a perfect preliminary round, won’t move past the quarterfinals. Two American skiers, Alex Hall and Nick Goepper, took gold and silver in slopestyle.
articles.content:
The American skiers Alex Hall, left, and Nick Goepper took gold and silver in slopestyle skiing on Wednesday.Credit...Dylan Martinez/Reuters

articles.author: Mike McRae
articles.title: American Woman Appears to Be Entirely Cured of HIV After Unique Medical Treatment - ScienceAlert
articles.description: Ten years ago, an unnamed American woman was diagnosed with HIV. Like the tens of thousands of people who test positive in the US each year, she faced a lifetime of anti-retroviral therapies to keep the virus from obliterating her immune system.

articles.title: Liberia kicks off bicentennial celebrating arrival of Black Americans - Reuters
articles.description: President George Weah on Monday called on Liberians to embrace unity and reconciliation as he launched year-long celebrations of the bicentennial of the arrival of the first free Black Americans in 1822.
